div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 350 Crete, c. 1898 (281) Burial: c. 65-60 B.C. (Raven) Contents: 12+ AR Cydonia: 2 tetradr. (as Svoronos pl. 10, 1 and Athenian type) Eleutherna: 1 st. (cf. Sv. pl. 11, 17) Gortyna: 1 st. (as Sv. pl. 14) 3 tetradr. (2 Athenian type, 1 Metellus) Hierapytna: 1 didr. (Sv. pl. 17, 18) Phaestus: 1 dr. (Sv. pl. 24, 4) 1 hemidr. (Sv. pl. 24, 10) ANS 1944.100.40767 ANS 1944.100.40769 Polyrhenium: 1 tetradr. (Athenian type) 1 hemidr. (Sv. pl. 26, 5) ANS 1944.100.40793 Disposition: New York 7 (Cydonia 1, Eleutherna 1, Gortyna 1, Phaestus 2, Polyrhenium 2); Berlin 1 (Cydonia Athenian); London 1 (Metellus); Athens 1 (Gortyna Athenian); Lam- bros 1 (Gortyna Athenian, Hirsch Dec. 12-14, 1961, 588) Dressel, ZfN 1898, pp. 321-2; 1904, p. 70 Raven, NC 1938, pp. 151-2 Raven suggests (p. 152, note 35) that 5 other Cretan tetradrs. of Athenian type may belong to this hd.: 3 in London (Gortyna, Polyrhenium, Pri- ansus), 1 in Berlin (Gortyna) and cast in Berlin (Lappa)
